newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHLETICS-STADIUM CLOSED TO SPECTATORS AFTER STOCKHOLM BOMB.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-STADIUM CLOSED TO SPECTATORS AFTER STOCKHOLM BOMB.

text.p: The Panathinaikon stadium was closed to spectators hoping to watch the finish of the world women's marathon on Saturday for security reasons following the bomb which destroyed part of Stockholm's Olympic stadium on Friday.
An IAAF official said the stadium, used for the first modern Olympics in 1896, had been closed on the orders of Athens mayor Dimitris Avramopoulos.
The Stockholm bomb followed a series of arson attacks which Swedish media have linked to opponents of the city's bid for the 2004 Olympics. Athens is also bidding for the 2004 Games.
